TopicTitle: Kerbin Circumnavigation Challenge - Reloaded [New Rules Once More]

Articles.Content:
Well, this was my first challenge that I've ever tried, and it looked easy enough. I had plenty of fuel left, but by the time I was coming in for a landing at KSC, I found out that my center of mass was out of tune with my center of lift, and I couldn't control it's descent. Jebediah survived, somehow, but most of the aircraft didn't. And I had stayed below 25km the entire way, too! I thought I had it in the bag . Maybe if I had thought about it while spinning out of control, I may have been able to transfer fuel from the back fuselages to the front ones and get the center of mass back on track. But I panicked .

Starting to loose control.

Aww, crap.

Of course, Jeb survives, even though the thing was tumbling out of control towards the ground...

I think I shall try again another time, because that took up a good hour to do.

AHA! Success! I was able to circumnavigate Kerbin...without spinning out of control and crashing this time! I added an SAS unit to help increase torque and CoM towards the front of the craft, and added a few more control surfaces to move the center of lift back a little bit farther, so that when it came time to land, everything would be stable.

In the SPH.

Coming in for a landing.

Success!

It appears as if I have enough fuel to go around Kerbin again. So, if there's a challenge to do that, I'm ready for it!

EDIT: Wooh wooh! I was able to circumnavigate a second time with the fuel I had left!

Taking off from KSC again.

Kerbol-rise.

Coming in hot, craft remains stable.

Aiming for runway this time.

Safe landing!

(No mods, dev console, cheats, etc.)

Great shot (and props for the effort and time you've spent to do it twice), but based on your flight records, you have overlooked another rule:

-One must not exceed 25,000m (that is, going 25,001m and above will void your attempt)

Thus voiding your attempt. Sorry.

I made it! It took me longer than I expected, and it ended way past my bedtime. But, I've gotten it done. And it was good stuff. I had some trouble keeping it level, so I was doing a lot of up-and-down. But I managed to stay below the 25km marker.

-snip-

This was a successful attempt to get around Kerbin using a relatively small craft with one jet. The 'Lazy Rabbit' uses capsule torque and thrust vectoring for control, so there are no active or inactive control surfaces on it. It flies quite nicely, with good response and predictable handling. Circumnavigation took a while, but it was a short jaunt compared to most any orbital flight plan. Here's the gallery, hopefully I've finally figure out how to use the correct bb code tags.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

So, I was trying this as a self-challenge before I ever saw this thread, though I was just using stock aircraft.

I tried it with an Albatross 3, going east, going full throttle, mainly between about 10,000 and 15,000 meters, and got 197 degrees around the world (basically to the far side of the Big Empty Continent).

I tried it again but at only slightly above 25% throttle. Kept to between 11,000 to 14,000 meters most of the way. At the halfway point (105 E), I seemed to have more than half my fuel left, so I thought this was going to be no problem.

However, on the next half, I was getting up as high as 18,000 meters. It seemed to be easier to gain stable altitude (I presume because my weight was down with the fuel depleting). But by the time I got back to the west side of the home continent (where the KSC is), I was running on vapors.

And then...urk....when I was over that mountain range just west of the KSC, I ran out of fuel completely. But, the Alabatross 3 is a good glider, so I was able to make it those final 60 or whatever kilometers gliding. Whew!

My trip time was slightly over 4 hours (No, I didn't do it in one sitting, I basically quicksaved every hour and did it across 4 evenings).

I'm not sure what I could have done to still have a little fuel left at the end. Maybe if I had never climbed above 14,000 to 15,000 meters.

Doing mine right now!

I finally finished! After almost 2 hours! I present to you, the circumnavigatir

i ran out of fuel past the mountains and turned around to land behind the KSC in the opposite direction i left in!

After so long, i am truly amazed at my dedication and lack of social life.

plugins: crew manifest; final frontier(ribbons for kerbals)

all stock, no timewarp, no hacks, etc.
